author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Fukushima's fury, into the sea doth seep,
Greened by the hand of the sky-god, Gaia's keep,
Thus spake the fiery-eyed IAEA - a jest? 
Alike discharges by land-kings, they said it best.

Volkswagen, steed of iron, announces plan of growth,
A hoard of shining coins in hand, they take the oath,
By 2026, in Brazil's realms, they hope to rise,
An increase by hammer's score, under sunlit skies.

SoftBank's wise Son, dreams of thought-weavers waking,
In every industry, their eerie silence breaking,
Outmatching our brain-strong warriors, a chilling song,
A world ethereal, where the mind-stones belong.

feedItems.title: Japan Discharge of Fukushima Radioactive Water Into Pacific Gets Green Light
feedItems.description: The IAEA said Japan’s plan was safe and in line with similar discharges carried out by nations around the world that operate nuclear-power plants.

feedItems.title: Volkswagen Outlines Brazilian Growth Plan
feedItems.description: Volkswagen said it will invest €1 billion by 2026 in Brazil, where it plans to grow by 40% in the next several years.

feedItems.title: SoftBank's Son Envisions AI Eventually Being Used in Every Industry
feedItems.description: SoftBank Group Chief Executive Masayoshi Son said artificial intelligence would be overwhelmingly smarter than the human brain and could eventually be used in any industry.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In the kingdom fair of commerce, the dollar holds its sway,
Unmoved by the silence of markets on this festive day.
Yet secrets hidden in the morrow’s transcripts may convey,
Of future lifts of interest, deciding its ascend or lay.

Upon the ocean's bosom, the oil in dances light doth play,
Diverged from supply and demand, to macro's tune they sway.
In the realm of numbers grand, their course does find its way,
Guided by the unseen hand, whispered by the sprites of ING.

Alas, the metals fair in consternation lie arrayed,
From iron stern to golden gleam, their worth in wait is stayed.
A shroud of doubt, upon the globe in dire form is laid,
Dousing their desire's fire, in gloom their shine's betrayed.

feedItems.title: Dollar Stays Steady for Now, Vulnerable to Jobs Data on Friday
feedItems.description: The dollar was steady with U.S. markets closed and as traders awaited Wednesday’s Fed minutes and Friday’s jobs data—which might give clues on further interest-rate rises.

feedItems.title: Oil Inches Higher as Macro Environment Dominates Over Fundamentals
feedItems.description: Crude futures gained, with price movements recently more aligned with the macro environment than supply and demand fundamentals, according to ING.

feedItems.title: Metals Mixed Over Economic Uncertainty
feedItems.description: Base metals were mixed, with gold a touch higher, as worries over the global economy continued to dampen demand.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Oh, low supply of bonds the kingdoms trade,
Just nine and ninety goats, so Citi bade.
In eurozone, 'tis not a merry joust,
The lowest yield, as rabbits in a drought!

Words from the East bring news of rocks and chips,
Retaliation, like a dog that nips.
Without their gallium, the circuit chills,
Silent the snails when Beijing instills.

Yet, German lands in trade have faltered now,
Exporting less, the dog cannot kowtow.
Its bounty shrinks, like a lone snail's trail,
Yet imports rise; may home demand prevail!

feedItems.title: Eurozone Government Bond Supply Seen Under EUR100 Bln in July
feedItems.description: Government supply in the eurozone is expected to amount to €97 billion in July, the lowest monthly supply year to date in 2023, Citi said.

feedItems.title: China Restricts Exports of Two Minerals Used in High-Performance Chips
feedItems.description: Industry executives see Beijing’s export ban on gallium and germanium as retaliation over chip curbs by the U.S. and others.

feedItems.title: Germany's Trade Surplus Falls on Weaker Exports
feedItems.description: German exports unexpectedly fell 0.1% in May, although imports rose, a sign that domestic demand could be improving despite a global economic slowdown.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In Sainsbury's court, the scribes do tell,
Of sales that rise and doubt that fell.
The price of bread no longer unkind,
A blessed relief for common mind.

A wager’s place, of wealth profound,
In Casino’s hall, two offers found.
EP Global and Fimalac's hold,
In golden talents, their stories told.

In carbon's keep secrets lie,
HP, Holcim, and Nestlé sigh.
Take heed, they say, and start to count,
For in small deeds, large woes surmount.

feedItems.title: Sainsbury's Backs Outlook as Sales Rise
feedItems.description: Sainsbury’s confirmed its full-year profit guidance after reporting a 9.8% rise in first-quarter same-store sales and said U.K. food inflation was starting to fall.

feedItems.title: Casino Gets Offers to Boost Capital
feedItems.description: Casino has received two proposals to strengthen its capital base, with the offers from EP Global and Fimalac and 3F Holding both . being considered.

feedItems.title: How to Start Accounting for Carbon
feedItems.description: Holcim, HP and Nestlé sustainability executives offer simple steps to get started.
